intro: Cistanche salsa var. longidens, commonly known as the long-stemmed Chinese parasitic plant, is a member of the Orobanchaceae family. It is a hemiparasitic plant that attaches to the roots of host plants, primarily those in the Fabaceae family, to obtain water and nutrients. The plant is characterized by its yellowish-orange, fleshy stems and lack of true leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. This species is native to arid and semi-arid regions of China and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
